speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about these involuntary movements you're experiencing, when did they start and how often do they occur? Have you noticed any triggers that make them worse or better?

speaker: Patient
text: They started a few months ago, I'd say. At first, it was just my hands twitching every now and then, but lately, my whole arm will jerk out to the side without me wanting it to. It happens pretty often, maybe a dozen times a day, and it seems to get worse when I'm stressed or anxious.

speaker: Doctor
text: That's very helpful to know. Can you describe these episodes of difficulty swallowing you're experiencing, are they painful and do they happen with both liquids and solids? Have you lost any weight recently due to this issue?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, the difficulty swallowing... it's really frustrating. Sometimes I feel like my throat is closing up and I have to force the food down, and other times it just gets stuck. It happens with both liquids and solids, but it seems worse with solids. And yes, I've lost some weight, maybe 10 pounds or so over the past few months, because eating has become such a chore.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your speech or voice, such as slurring or hoarseness, and have you noticed any difficulty with coordination or balance, like stumbling or falling? REQUEST TEST: Brain_MRI

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Atrophy of the caudate nuclei with ex vacuo dilatation of the frontal horns of the lateral ventricles.

speaker: Doctor
text: The atrophy of the caudate nuclei is quite significant. Can you tell me if you've experienced any changes in your cognitive function or mood, such as memory loss, confusion, or depression? Have you noticed any problems with your vision or eye movements? REQUEST TEST: Blood_work_to_check_for_Huntington_disease_marker

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Positive for the huntingtin (HTT) gene mutation.

speaker: Doctor
text: With the positive result for the HTT gene mutation, I'd like to ask, have you noticed any changes in your emotional state or behavior, such as irritability, anxiety, or mood swings? And do you have a family history of Huntington's disease or any similar neurological disorders? REQUEST TEST: Cognitive_function_assessment

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Mental_Status: Confused, oriented to person and place only.

speaker: Doctor
text: Your confusion and disorientation are concerning symptoms. Can you tell me if you've experienced any hallucinations or delusions, and have you noticed any changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels? REQUEST TEST: Psychiatric_evaluation

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe your family history of neurological disorders in more detail, specifically regarding Huntington's disease, and have any of your relatives exhibited similar symptoms to yours, such as involuntary movements or difficulty swallowing? REQUEST TEST: Genetic_counseling_report

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Positive for the huntingtin (HTT) gene mutation, indicating a strong likelihood of Huntington's disease being present in the family history.

speaker: Doctor
text: Given the positive HTT gene mutation result and the family history of similar symptoms, can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in your daily activities or ability to perform tasks due to your symptoms, and have you experienced any falls or injuries as a result of your involuntary movements? REQUEST TEST: Physical_therapy_evaluation

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about how your daily life has been impacted by these symptoms, for example, have you had to stop working or give up any hobbies due to your difficulty swallowing or involuntary movements? Have you noticed any changes in your relationships with family and friends as a result of your condition? REQUEST TEST: Neuropsychological_evaluation

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: It seems like the neuropsychological evaluation didn't reveal any significant abnormalities. Can you tell me if you've experienced any changes in your autonomic functions, such as problems with temperature regulation, blood pressure, or heart rate? Have you noticed any issues with bladder or bowel control? REQUEST TEST: Autonomic_nervous_system_evaluation

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Vital_Signs: Temperature - 36.8°C (98.2°F), Blood_Pressure - 130/85 mmHg, Heart_Rate - 72 bpm, Respiratory_Rate - 14 breaths/min; all within normal limits for autonomic functions related to these measurements.

speaker: Doctor
text: Your vital signs appear to be within normal limits, which is good. Can you tell me if you've experienced any changes in your sensation or perception, such as numbness, tingling, or pain in your extremities? Have you noticed any differences in your sense of smell or taste? REQUEST TEST: Electroencephalogram

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: Given the normal readings from the electroencephalogram, I'd like to ask, have you experienced any changes in your ability to perform fine motor tasks, such as buttoning a shirt or tying your shoelaces, and have you noticed any differences in your sense of balance or equilibrium when walking or standing? REQUEST TEST: Reflex_test

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Delayed return to neutral ankle position after triggering the plantar reflex.

speaker: Doctor
text: The delayed return to neutral ankle position after triggering the plantar reflex is a significant finding. Can you tell me if you've experienced any changes in your muscle tone or stiffness, such as rigidity or spasms, and have you noticed any weakness in your muscles, particularly in your arms or legs? REQUEST TEST: Electromyography

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: With the normal electromyography results, I'd like to ask, have you experienced any changes in your gait or walking pattern, such as stumbling or having a hard time initiating movement? And do you feel like your symptoms are progressively getting worse over time? REQUEST TEST: Gait_analysis

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: Considering the normal gait analysis results and the progressive worsening of your symptoms, can you tell me if you've experienced any changes in your ability to perform daily activities, such as dressing or feeding yourself, and have you required any assistance from others due to your condition? REQUEST TEST: Activities_of_Daily_Living_Assessment

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: Given the normal results from the Activities of Daily Living Assessment, I'd like to ask, have you noticed any changes in your overall quality of life or sense of well-being since your symptoms started, and do you feel like there are any specific factors that exacerbate or relieve your symptoms? REQUEST TEST: Quality_of_Life_Survey

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text:
With all the test results in, I'd like to ask one final question: Are you experiencing any significant distress or disruption in your daily life due to your symptoms, and are there any specific concerns or fears you have about your condition? REQUEST TEST: None, as we've reached the limit of 20 questions. 

(I will make a diagnosis after this)

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Huntington's disease, given the positive result for the huntingtin (HTT) gene mutation, atrophy of the caudate nuclei, and symptoms such as involuntary movements, difficulty swallowing, and cognitive changes.
